Indonesia-US Trade Deal ‘Not Ideal,’ Economist Says
body: Indonesia’s new US trade deal is “not ideal” and may shrink its surplus as US goods enter tariff-free, economist Eko Listiyanto says.

title: JCI Gains as Rupiah Slips After Trump Lowers Tariffs on Indonesian Goods
body: JCI rises while the rupiah weakens after Trump cuts tariffs on Indonesian goods in exchange for US market access and Boeing jet purchases.

title: ASEAN-China Trade Pact May Not Mean Southeast Asia Picks Xi over Trump
body: ASEAN is currently in the process of upgrading its trade pact with China amidst Trump's tariff fiasco.

title: Apindo: Disproportionate US Tariffs Threaten Indonesia’s Export Competitiveness
body: The Trump-era tariffs might not be overly concerning if Indonesia were treated equally with other countries.

title: US Tariff Aftermath: Indonesia Can Lose Its Palm Oil Market to Malaysia
body: Indonesia might lose its palm oil market to Malaysia if its fails to get a lower tariff in its negotiations with the Trump government.

title: Chinese Growth Slows Slightly to 5.2 Pct Amid Trade Wars with US
body: China’s economy grew 5.2% in Q2, slightly slower than Q1, as exports stayed strong despite ongoing trade war pressures.

title: EU Plans Countermeasures to Trump's 'Unacceptable' 30% Tariffs
body: Brussels decided to suspend retaliatory tariffs on US goods scheduled to take effect Monday in hopes of reaching a trade deal with the US.

title: Apindo Maps Worst-Case Scenarios from US Tariffs
body: Apindo warns a planned 32% US tariff on Indonesian goods could spark mass layoffs, rupiah volatility, and deeper economic challenges.

title: Indonesia May Scrap US Energy Imports if Tariffs Stay, Minister Says
body: Indonesia may cancel U.S. energy imports if Washington keeps tariffs, Energy Minister Bahlil says, awaiting a decision from top negotiator.

title: Indonesia’s External Debt Climbs 6.8% to Reach $435.6 Billion
body: Government external debt reached $209.6 billion in May 2025, registering a 9.8 percent year-on-year increase.

title: China's Exports Jump 5.8% in June as Tariffs Reprieve Prompts a Rush of Orders
body: Exports to the United States fell 16 percent, but that was less than half the 34.5 percent drop seen in May.

title: Prabowo Says US, EU Remain ‘Very Important’ as Trump Ignites Trade War
body: Prabowo and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen are among the world leaders that had received Trump’s tariff threat letters.

title: Prabowo Urges Stronger EU Investment as Landmark Free Trade Deal Nears Ratification
body: Indonesia remains only the EU’s 5th-largest trading partner and 5th-biggest recipient of foreign direct investment among ASEAN countries.

title: EU Grants Indonesia Multi-Entry Schengen Visa as Landmark Trade Deal Nears Completion
body: The multi-entry Schengen visa allows holders to travel freely across 29 European countries without undergoing border checks.

title: EU Chief: Indonesia-EU Trade Deal Sends Strong Signal on Predictable Partnerships
body: Both Indonesia and the EU are facing mounting trade pressures, including steep tariffs from the United States under President Donald Trump.

title: Prabowo Courts EU Leaders in Brussels to Finalize Zero-Tariff Trade Deal
body: Under CEPA, 80 percent of Indonesia’s exports to the EU are expected to enjoy zero tariffs within one to two years of implementation.

title: A Look at The Countries that Received Trump's Tariff Letters
body: Nearly every country has faced a minimum 10 percent levy on goods entering the US since April, on top of other levies on specific products.

title: Who’s on Trump’s Tariff Letter? 23 Countries Facing Higher Rates
body: Trump warns 23 countries of higher tariffs by Aug. 1 unless deals are reached, with rates ranging from 20 percent to 50 percent.

title: Lavrov Says ASEAN Shows Interest in Russia as US Tariffs Haunt Bloc
body: Russia says that Moscow's ties with ASEAN have started long before Trump's launched the tariff blitz.

title: ‘Trade Has Been Unfair’: Marco Rubio Defends Trump's Tariffs on ASEAN Nations
body: Marco Rubio says that many ASEAN economies will have better tariff rates compared to countries in other parts of the world.

title: New MRT Corridor to Cost Rp 50 Trillion, Connect East and West Jakarta
body: An open international tender is slated to be launched in October or November with funding secured from Japanese lenders.

title: Indonesia Turns to Brazil as Model for Bioethanol and Clean Energy Transition
body: Bahlil noted that 88 percent of Brazil’s electricity supply comes from low-carbon sources such as hydro, wind, solar, and bioenergy.

title: Indonesian Minister Apologizes, Cancels Plan for Tiny Subsidized Homes
body: "We still have a lot to learn -- public policy ideas must be better prepared before being introduced,” said Maruarar.

title: US Soybean Exporters Praise Indonesia for Avoiding Retaliatory Tariffs
body: According to USSEC data, the United States supplies up to 2.6 million tons of soybeans to Indonesia annually.

title: Trump's Tariffs A Wake-Up Call for Indonesia, Foreign Minister Says
body: Foreign Minister Sugiono says that Indonesia must build its economy as US President Donald Trump's tariff hikes loom.

title: Indonesia, Uganda Eye Greater Trade Amid Trump’s Tariff Whiplash
body: In the first five months of 2025, Indonesia-Uganda trade already hit $72 million, already surpassing 2024 numbers.

title: US Tariff Threatens 70,000 Textile Jobs in Indonesia
body: Indonesia’s textile industry may cut 50,000–70,000 jobs if the US enforces a 32% tariff, hitting exports that account for 40% of the sector.

title: X CEO Linda Yaccarino Resigns, But Why Is No One Surprised?
body: Linda Yaccarino has resigned as CEO of Elon Musk’s X after two turbulent years, leaving the platform grappling with ad challenges.

title: Bridge Collapse Triggers Ban on Coal Trucks in Indonesia’s Coal-Heavy Province
body: South Sumatra has banned coal trucks from a key bridge after a collapse, underscoring the strain Indonesia’s coal boom places on roads.

title: Healthcare to Logistics: Four IPOs Drive IDX Gains Past 7,000
body: Four companies debuted on the IDX, lifting the Jakarta index above 7,000, as investor appetite remains strong.

title: Coal Still Key to Indonesia’s Growth, Kalimantan Critical to Economy, Officials Say
body: Kalimantan supplies 82% of Indonesia’s coal output, with officials calling it crucial for energy security and state revenue.

title: Indonesia Will Not Leave BRICS Despite US Tariff Threat
body: Indonesia says it won’t leave BRICS even if the U.S. imposes a 42% tariff, as Airlangga leads talks to defuse trade tensions.

title: Airlangga Reports Positive Talks With US on Looming Tariffs
body: Indonesia is pushing talks and energy deals with the US to avert Trump’s looming 32% tariffs on Indonesian exports starting August 1.

title: Malaysian PM Warns ASEAN That Trade War Is Not a 'Passing Storm'
body: Six ASEAN members are among the 14 countries that could see duties on their exports to the US skyrocket on Aug. 1.

title: Public Works Ministry Seeks $769M Budget Hike for Boarding School Project Backed by President Prabowo
body: In the initial phase, the Sekolah Rakyat program will convert existing government buildings into national-standard schools.

title: Army General Named New Bulog Chief as Predecessor Returns to Military
body: Maj. Gen. Ahmad Rizal Ramdhani has been selected to succeed Novi, but he must first retire from the Indonesian Armed Forces (TNI).

title: Pertamina Inks MoUs with Exxon, Chevron to Sweeten Indonesia's Tariff Offer
body: Kilang Pertamina Indonesia also struck an MoU with energy trading firm KDT Global Resources.

title: Indonesia’s Textile Industry Braces for Job Cuts as US Tariffs Loom
body: Indonesia's textile industry faces layoffs as looming US tariffs threaten exports, with ready-made garments valued at $1.27B at risk.

title: Indonesia Eyes Oil Sector Investment to Appease Trump’s Tariff Wrath
body: Donald Trump has told Prabowo Subianto that he would drop the tariff plans if Indonesia invests in the US.

title: CDIA Soars in Trading Debut Following $145 Million IPO
body: CDIA surges 35% in its Jakarta debut after a record oversubscribed IPO, raising $145 million to expand infrastructure investments.
